H0.text: Water eroding the land is the process that forms coal, a fossil fuel.

H1.text: Meteors hitting Earth are the source that forms coal, a fossil fuel.

H2.text: Repeated volcanic eruptions are the process from which coal, a fossil fuel, is formed.

H3.text: The decay of organic material is what coal, a fossil fuel, is formed from.

A4.text: Coal is a fossil fuel, formed when plants decay into peat which is converted into coal by the heat and pressure of deep burial over millions of years.
